story.iWant: Omega to greet me with an energizing morning briefing when I start Mission Control
story.soThat: I immediately understand my priorities and context for the day ahead
story.description: Build an autonomous morning briefing that executes when Mission Control starts (integrated with Story 2.4 startup system). The briefing greets user with energy and context, summarizes today's must-win tasks, highlights overdue items, shows available time blocks, offers to run full daily planning, and loads relevant context from memory. This is Omega's "first impression" - energizing, focused, and valuable. Duration: 30 seconds to read. Trigger: Automatic on startup (morning hours). Voice: Omega's energetic, action-oriented style.

criterion.title: Morning Briefing Function Created
criterion.description: - File: mission-control/src/morning_briefing.py - Function: generate_morning_briefing() returns formatted text - Integrates with src/startup.py (Story 2.4) - Executes automatically on startup during morning hours (6am-12pm learned time)

criterion.title: Briefing Content Structure
criterion.description: - Greeting (time-aware: "Good morning!") - Date and day of week - Must-win tasks (from task system) - Overdue tasks (if any) - Available time blocks - Prompt to run daily planning - Omega's energetic sign-off

criterion.title: Context from Memory Loaded
criterion.description: - User's name (from business context) - Must-win tasks (from task system) - Overdue tasks (from task system) - Yesterday's completion stats (optional, from memory) - Any pending notifications (from notification system)

criterion.title: Time-Aware Greeting
criterion.description: - Morning (6am-12pm): "Good morning! ‚ö°" - Afternoon (12pm-5pm): "Good afternoon! Let's refocus." - Evening (5pm-10pm): "Good evening! Wrapping up or planning tomorrow?" - Night/Early (10pm-6am): Skip briefing (user is likely not working)

criterion.title: Task Summary Quality
criterion.description: - Shows top 3 must-win tasks (if set from yesterday's planning) - Shows overdue count (without overwhelming details) - Shows today's task count - Highlights if no tasks are planned (prompts planning)

criterion.title: Actionable Next Steps
criterion.description: - If tasks exist: "Ready to execute? Type 'go' to begin!" - If no tasks: "Want to plan your day? Type 'plan my day' to start." - If overdue exists: "You have {n} overdue tasks. Want to triage?" - Always includes option to run daily planning workflow

criterion.title: Performance and UX
criterion.description: - Briefing generates in less than 500ms - Output is formatted with Rich library (colors, emphasis) - Not too verbose (30 seconds to read) - Skippable (doesn't block conversation start) - User preference: can disable briefing in settings

doc.title: Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: "Mission Control should greet users warmly and set a positive, productive tone from the first interaction. Every interaction should feel like collaborating with a trusted executive team member."

doc.title: Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: "Users can plan their day with Omega (Operator agent) including morning briefings, daily planning sessions, time blocking, and end-of-day wrap-ups. Morning briefing shows: must-win tasks, calendar summary, energy assessment."

doc.title: Solution Architecture
doc.snippet: "Use Rich library for formatted CLI output with colors, panels, tables, and progress indicators. All agent outputs should use Rich formatting for visual hierarchy and clarity."

doc.title: Story 3.1: Operator Agent Persona (Omega)
doc.snippet: "Omega is energetic, action-oriented, uses momentum language ('Let's go!', 'Let's execute'), celebrates progress, challenges gently, and includes ‚ö° emoji for energy. Always focused on 'what's next action?'"

doc.title: Story 3.2: Task Data Model
doc.snippet: "Provides get_must_win_tasks(), get_tasks_by_status(status), get_tasks_by_priority(priority), get_tasks_summary(). Tasks have priority levels including 'must_win_today' and status values including 'todo', 'done', 'blocked'."

package.name: rich
package.usage: CLI formatting, panels, colors for briefing output

constraints.constraint: Briefing generation must complete in under 500ms (AC7 requirement)
Follow modular monolith pattern: morning_briefing.py as standalone module, integrated via startup.py
Briefing must be concise (30 seconds to read maximum). No walls of text.
Use Rich library for all output formatting (panels, colors, emphasis)
All functions must have docstrings with type hints (Python 3.13+ style)
Graceful degradation required - briefing should work even if tasks/memory unavailable
Minimum 15 unit tests covering all ACs and edge cases (per story testing strategy)
Omega's personality must be consistent: energetic, action-oriented, uses ‚ö° emoji, momentum language
Briefing behavior changes based on time: morning (6am-12pm), afternoon (12pm-5pm), evening (5pm-10pm), night (skip)
Must integrate with existing startup.py without breaking current initialization flow

interface.name: generate_morning_briefing
interface.description: Main function that generates and returns formatted morning briefing text with Rich markup

interface.name: get_time_aware_greeting
interface.description: Returns greeting based on time of day. Returns None for night hours (10pm-6am) to skip briefing.

interface.name: format_task_summary
interface.signature: def format_task_summary(must_wins: List[Dict], overdue: List[Dict], today_tasks: List[Dict]) -> str
interface.description: Formats task summary section showing must-wins, overdue count, and today's tasks

interface.name: suggest_next_action
interface.signature: def suggest_next_action(must_wins: List[Dict], overdue: List[Dict]) -> str
interface.description: Suggests next action based on task state (execute, triage, or plan)

interface.name: should_show_briefing
interface.description: Determines if briefing should show based on time and user preferences

interface.name: get_overdue_tasks
interface.description: Returns tasks with due_date in the past and status != 'done'. To be implemented or use get_tasks_by_status.

interface.name: get_todays_tasks
interface.description: Returns tasks scheduled for today (due_date = today or no due_date with status='todo')

tests.standards: Use pytest framework. All tests in tests/test_morning_briefing.py. Follow existing test patterns: - Descriptive test names (test_feature_scenario__expected_result) - Fixtures for test data setup - Assert statements with clear messages - Mock external dependencies (file I/O, datetime) - Performance tests with timing assertions - 100% test coverage for all public functions
